intro: Veronica townsonii, commonly known as Townsend's speedwell, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, such as meadows and slopes. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces numerous small flowers arranged in clusters. Veronica townsonii is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
